definition: abbr. for the Philippines 菲律賓|菲律宾[Fei1 lu:4 bin1]

sentences.english: This expensive spice was used only sparingly in cooking.
sentences.chinese: 这种价格不菲的调味品仅是用来烹调时节省地使用。

sentences.english: I think all holidays have kinda gone overboard, and Halloween is one of them.
sentences.chinese: 我认为所有的节日都花销不菲，万圣节只是其中之一。

sentences.english: With high oil prices, France's middle class is struggling to come up with ways to save on gas.
sentences.chinese: 因油价不菲，法国中产阶级也开始想尽办法省油了。

sentences.english: Mei said that couples must spend a lot of money for these photo shoots.
sentences.chinese: 梅说，情侣们会为这些照片的拍摄花费不菲。

sentences.english: A personal trainer can be expensive, but well worth the investment.
sentences.chinese: 请一位私人教练价格不菲，但是物有所值。

sentences.english: Water diversion is not cheap, but the price of desalination is falling.
sentences.chinese: 分水工程价格不菲，而海水脱盐淡化的价格在下降。

sentences.english: The expensive reception dinner for the honored guests featured shark's fin.
sentences.chinese: 招待那些贵宾的翅席价格不菲啊。

sentences.english: Her husband is a well-paid physicist.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫是一位物理学家，收入不菲。

sentences.english: His handwritten poems are worth a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他手写的诗稿价值不菲。

sentences.english: Stone walls are substantial replacements for stakes and logs, as their cost shows.
sentences.chinese: 石制城墙远比木墙坚固，当然亦造价不菲。

sentences.english: He has been working, well-paid, about the oppression of my liberated.
sentences.chinese: 他有了工作，收入不菲，一下从我的压迫下解放了。

sentences.english: It is demanding and it is not cheap, but it brings results.
sentences.chinese: 它要求苛刻且费用不菲，但是能带来成效。

sentences.english: Despite a large income, the actor had saved very little because he is profuse spender.
sentences.chinese: 这个演员虽然收入不菲，但是挥金如土，积蓄甚少。

sentences.english: You really have a keen eye. This ring is rather expensive.
sentences.chinese: 你真是好眼力，这戒指的价格可不菲啊。

sentences.english: But biodegradable bags "cost a fortune," Jones said.
sentences.chinese: 但是琼斯也表示，生物降解的袋子“价格不菲”。

definition: the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
